intro: Erigeron acris proles angulosus, commonly known as the angular leaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Its angular, lobed leaves are a distinguishing feature, and it produces small white to pale yellow flowers. It is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
